METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: »Evropska Slatina« v prvi polovici 19. stoletja
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: »The European Character of Rogaška Slatina Thermal Spa« in the First Half of the 19th Century
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Cvelfar, Bojan
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: The brief period of agony at the end of the 18th century, when the mineral spring in Rogaška Slatina was being exploited by at least five landowners, was ended by the purchase of the spring and the surrounding area by the Styrian provincial diets. Representing a veritable treasure house of data, guest rosters from the first half of the 19th century are among the most valuable documents on the thermal spa. They list the number and professional structure of spa guests; their place of origin; the length of their stay; and the reason for their arrival. This period brought about considerable changes in the overall plan and design of the spa building. The life of spa’s guests, however, followed the usual routine of following their doctors’ Orders that included the drinking diet, bathing in the warm thermal water, long walks, and trips to the surrounding countryside.

Kratko dobo agonije konec 18. stoletja, ko je vrelec v Rogaški Slatini izkoriščalo vsaj pet posestnikov, so z nakupom vrelca in zemljišč okoli njega prekinili štajerski deželni stanovi. Med najbolj dragocene ohranjene dokumente o zdravilišču iz prve polovice 19. stoletja sodijo imeniki gostov. Ti so prava zakladnica podatkov o številu, poklicnem in krajevnem izvoru gostov, trajanju in vzroku njihovega bivanja v Rogaški Slatini. Pri stavbni zasnovi je ta doba prinesla ogromne spremembe. Samo življenje v zdravilišču pa so narekovala zdravniška navodila, predvsem pitna kura, kopanje, sprehodi ter izleti v bližnjo okolico.
